bill.title: Elections; Absentee Ballots; Unique Ballots; Office of Elections Package
bill.description: Permits the mailing of absentee ballots to all registered voters in areas with fewer than five hundred voters that would otherwise require a unique ballot type and an individual polling place. (SD1)

history.action: (H) Prefiled
(H) Introduced and Pass First Reading.
(H) Referred to JUD, FIN, referral sheet 1
(H) Bill scheduled to be heard by JUD on Tuesday, 01-24-12 2:00PM in House conference room 325.

(H) The committees on JUD recommend that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes were as follows: 13 Ayes: Keith-Agaran, Rhoads, Brower, Coffman, Herkes, Ito, Luke, McKelvey, Souki, Tsuji, Fontaine, Marumoto, Thielen; Ayes with reservations: none; 0 Noes: none; and 2 Excused: Cabanilla, Carroll.
(H) Reported from JUD (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 11-12) as amended in HD 1, recommending passage on Second Reading and referral to FIN.

(H) Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with Representative(s) Ching voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Cabanilla, Carroll, Luke excused (3).
(H) Bill scheduled to be heard by FIN on Friday, 02-24-12 12:00PM in House conference room 308.

(H) The committees on FIN recommend that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes were as follows: 16 Ayes: Representative(s) Oshiro, M. Lee, Choy, Cullen, Giugni, Har, Hashem, Ichiyama, Jordan, C. Lee, Morikawa, Tokioka, Yamashita, Marumoto, Riviere, Ward; Ayes with reservations: none; Noes: none; and 1 Excused: Representative(s) Kawakami.
(H) Reported from FIN (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 767-12), recommending passage on Third Reading.
(H) Passed Third Reading with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and none excused (0). Transmitted to Senate.
(S) Received from House (Hse. Com. No. 75).
(S) Passed First Reading.
(S) Referred to JDL.
(S) The committee(s) on JDL has scheduled a public hearing on 03-13-12 10:15AM in conference room 016.

(S) The committee(s) on JDL recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in JDL were as follows: 5 Aye(s): Senator(s) Hee, Shimabukuro, Gabbard, Ihara, Slom; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 0 Excused: none.
(S) Reported from JDL (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 2886) with recommendation of passage on Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and placement on the calendar for Third Reading.
(S) Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1).
(S) 48 Hrs. Notice 03-23-12.
(S) Passed Third Reading, as amended (SD 1). Ayes, 24; Aye(s) with reservations: none . Noes, 0 (none). Excused, 1 (Senator(s) Green). Transmitted to House.
(H) Returned from Senate (Sen. Com. No. 427) in amended form (SD 1).
(H) House disagrees with Senate amendment (s).
(S) Received notice of disagreement (Hse. Com. No. 330).
(S) Senate Conferees appointed: Hee, Chair; Shimabukuro, Co-Chair(s); Slom.
(H) Received notice of Senate conferees (Sen. Com. No. 758).
(H) Reconsideration of action taken on 03-27-12
(S) Received notice of House reconsideration of action in disagreeing to the amendments proposed by the Senate (Hse. Com. No. 631).
(H) House agrees to Senate amendment(s).
(H) Passed Final Reading as amended in SD 1 with Representative(s) Ching voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Saiki excused (1).
(H) Transmitted to Governor.
(S) Received notice of House agreement and passage on Final Reading (Hse. Com. No. 644).
